inn1.comm: pitches it up and QDK drives it easily away from the body through the covers for four
quite wide outside off again and full, he drives but can't middle this time
on length and coming in towards off stump, QDK defends softly towards cover and calls for a run
right on target - full and on the stumps, Amla blocks it back
on length outside off and angling it away, Amla lets it go
swinging it away from length around off, Amla stays back and defends on the off side
on length on the pad, tucked to the leg side by QDK for one
pitched up outside off, Amla drives it square to point
pitches it a touch shorter as Amla comes down and turns it past midwicket for one
drifts it in towards the pads, driven easily to long-on for one
he pitches it short and flat as Amla comes down again and does well to adjust, played it uppishly to mid-on for a quick single
tossed up on length around off, turned to the leg side for one more
pitched up around off, driven down firmly to mid-off where the fielder does well to sop it
on length wider outside off, drives to the covers this time
well outside off on length, helped to third man for one
whipped in the air off the pads and that's gone across the boundary after a bounce! The length wasn't bad bu the line was and Amla cashed in by chipping it to the leg side
on length towards the off stump this time, Amla defends it back
on length outside off, Amla drives off the back foot to cover
pitches it up outside off, QDK drives it firmly off the front foot but straight to the fielder
touch closer to the batsman around similar length, firm drive down the ground to mid-off
but it's pulled away to the leg side for four! It was short and outside off and QDK had enough time to stay back and pull in the gap on leg side where there's no midwicket
slower ball beats QDK as it pitched on length outside off, QDK pushed away from the body and missed and the ball fell short of the keeper too
fullish outside off, punched firmly to cover
full delivery well outside off, powerful drive off the front foot and short cover gets a hand to it
it's a length delivery angled across and Amla caresses that along the ground through the covers. Nobody moves. Oh, he plays with such elegance. What timing!
from well wide of the crease and it's gone down leg for a wide
from wide of the crease again and angled into the pads, clipped to deep fine leg for one
short ball and that's a delicate hook played over short fine leg for four! He knew about the gap and once he saw the short ball, just made sure it was cleared the fielder in the circle behind square
towards the pads and that's tucked to the leg side for a single
angled in towards the off stump from length, Amla defends it on the leg side
on length outside off, helped to short third man with a late cut
angled in from round the wicket, QDK turns it to long-on for one
short and wide outside off, Amla crunches it off the back foot but point dives to his right and saves four runs
short of length outside off, Amla cuts it late to third man
too short again outside off, QDK pulls it from outside off to deep midwicket for two
too short or too full and it's full this time, driven handsomely for four through the covers! QDK didn't have to do much other than driving it in the gap to get four
better delivery, varies the pace by pitching it on length outside off and QDK defends towards short cover
angles in a length delivery from round the wicket, Amla defends back to the bowler
short of length and well outside off, Amla punches off the back foot towards backward point for one
find the gap again! It's way outside off and QDK cuts it off the back foot past backward point for another four
bouncer towards off stump, QDK pulls it to deep square leg but there's a man there to keep it to one
angled in towards off and middle, turned to deep fine leg with the wrists for one
on length just outside off, forward push to short cover from QDK
flighted outside off, swept straight to backward square leg
tossed up outside off, chipped in the air wide of midwicket to long-on for one
flighted and drifting in toward off stump, QDK defends it back
drifting it in again, QDK stays back to defend again
comes down the track and turns it from length to deep midwicket for one

Nyumbu has struck! Soft dismissal for Amla, he went down on a knee to sweep it with the turn behind square on leg, but the ball came a bit slow from short of length, got his glove on the way and got the top of off and middle stump
angled in towards the pads, helped to deep fine leg for one
too full and wide, swings away further to be called wide
brings it in this time from length around off, Faf drives it down to mid-on to get off the mark
down the leg side from round the wicket and QDK swats it to the fine-leg boundary where Taylor slides to his left and saves two
length delivery coming in, drives it down to long-on for one
short of length and wide outside off, Faf lets it go
short of length outside off again, punched off the back foot to short cover
tossed up on leg stump, turned with the wrists to deep midwicket by QDK
slightly flatter outside off, Faf defends it back
flatter again towards off stump, defends to short midwicket
around length outside off, drives it down to long-on
flighted on middle stump, QDK uses his feet to push it down to long-on and he's reached 1000 ODI runs
flighted towards the stumps, Faf comes down and defends it back to the bowler
turn on offer, from length outside off as QDK defends it to short cover
flighted around middle stump, QDK looks to clip to leg but gets an outside edge to the off side
pitched up a bit towards leg, driven down to long-on
flatter delivery and going towards leg, Faf opens up and helps it to deep midwicket
pitched up around middle, tucked straight to midwicket
flatter delivery towards the pads, hits him outside leg
turning in from outside off, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
goes to the back foot and punches it down to long-on after the ball turns in

Nyumbu gets another, and it's Quinton de Kock! Nyumbu tossed it up, QDK danced down the track and packed a powerful drive on the off side but Chigumbura dives to his left and takes a spectacular catch to get the big wicket
stays back and clips to backward square leg after the turn
flatter delivery coming in, AB helps it with the turn to midwicket
pitched it up outside off, AB drives it down to long-on to get off the mark

oh my, what has AB done here?! He wanted to clip the flatter delivery as it was going down leg, but the ball only hit the keeper and fell close to him. AB thought it had gone fine and ran for a single, Mutumbami merely picked the ball up and whipped the bails off as AB was halfway down the pitch
flighted outside off, JPD drives to cover
JPD looks to sweep the ball down leg but it;s a wide and they run one too
touch fuller and Faf turns it down to mid-on for one
just beats the outside off from length outside off, Duminy presented a forward defence but was beaten
he leans forward to block it from length this time
touch fuller and he drives it down to long-on for one
flighted outside off, JPD drives with the turn to cover
pitched up outside off, driven down firmly to long-off
on length well outside off, clipped to midwicket with the wrists by Faf
touch shorter and well outside off, Faf goes back and looks to cut but it spins a long way
goes to the back foot and whips it to midwicket with the turn
uses his feet and drives it down to long-on for one
pushed down the ground to long-on for one
he leans forward and blocks it back
goes back and across, drives it down to long-on
goes to the back foot and pushes it to square leg for one
goes back in the crease for the shorter ball and punches it to long-off
slightly fuller as Faf goes back again and helps it to midwicket
length delivery outside off, punched off the back foot past cover
tossed up well outside off, Faf goes back and defends it back
flighted just outside off, Faf pushes it down to long-on
from wide of the crease, round the wicket, pushed to cover with the turn by Duminy
pushed down to long-off off the back foot
goes to the back foot and he drives it down to long-on for one
stands up tall and punches a quicker, flatter ball down the pitch. Utseya won't let it pass
this time Faf places the drill down the ground better and finds long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, Duminy jams has bat down on it and jogs a single to long-on
brings him onto the front foot and Faf sticks to a straight blade
leans forward and caresses the flighted ball to long-off
loopy delivery, drifting in on middle. Duminy controls it well to midwicket
fuller and pushed across Faf, who drives to mid-off
shortish and he rides the little room on it to enjoy a single to third man
fuller and darting in at Duminy, he has to keep his front leg out of the way and clip wide of mid-on
strikes a good length with a little curl in to fool Duminy's forward defensive into an inside edge onto pad
lovely stroke, perhaps a little too much angle into the left-hander and Duminy has whipped it straight of midwicket
shortish on off stump, Duminy gets in line behind it
tossed up on middle, Faf makes a little room and drives to long-off
just a touch short and Duminy uses the crease well to pick a single to square leg
good flight on middle, Faf lunges forward to smother it
that gripped into the deck! A flatter ball digs in and turns well away from Faf who has to reach out with his punch to the covers
flighted almost outside leg, Faf ensures he doesn;t get in a tangle and pushes to long-off
a little shorter and Duminy jumps back to turn it away to long leg
and the invitation for a single is taken as Duminy bunts a flighted ball all along the carpet to long-on
take that! A little skip down the ground to lift a flighted ball clean over extra cover. Very fluent footwork from Faf
and that makes the bowler bowl shorter and he turns it away through square leg off the back foot
tossed up on middle, Duminy is forward to block
too short and too slow. JP could have cut that, crunched that through cover or hammered it down the ground but he chooses the pull and strikes it hard
goes back and is helped by the line coming in at him with Raza bowling around the wicket. Neat little flick behind square leg
finds a good length outside off, Duminy prefers the back foot to push down the ground
shortish again, allowing the batsman to use the depth of the crease and punch to long-on
waits for the ball to turn and has enough room to free his arms and slap a shortish ball down the ground
turns with the ball to open himself up and tap the ball in front of square leg. That's the hundred up
a little turn again, but the length allows the batsman to adjust to it and short-arm pull down to long-on
still a little on the shorter side and Duminy taps it through midwicket
that's more like it, even if he gave a little more air than necessary. Full toss tapped down to long-off
loopy delivery just outside off stump, Faf gets to the pitch and tucks it through square leg. Admirable control of flight again
tossed up on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
brings down a straight bat on a tossed up ball on off stump. Long-on gets some work now
that's the first quicker one of the over, Duminy is alert, stays back and punches to long-off
reaches the pitch and uses his wrists to flick this fuller delivery to the left of midwicket
straying on the pads and flicked away through midwicket
keeps it wicket-to-wicket and Duminy answers with a straight bat
fuller and just enough width for Duminy to lace it through the covers and bring up the first fifty partnership of the innings. South Africa steadying themselves
shortish, and a touch slower too, Faf is not fooled and works his wrists on top of the bounce to get a single through square leg

oopsy! That's another South African batsman who didn't really know where the ball was. Gets into a defence off a short of a length delivery and gets an inside edge. Faf though is clearly aware of the ball, which is where short leg might have been, and calls him through for a quick single
on the legs again and Faf has whipped it away to deep midwicket
gorgeous pace for a spinner, tossed the ball right up and a shade outside off. Faf plays with the spin to long-on
not as much flight on this and Faf is comfortable on the back foot and flicks to deep square leg
goes around to Duminy and pitches just short enough for the batsman to rock back and chop to the sweeper
gets back to a good length ball and pushes to long-on. More than enough singles on offer
a touch short and wide, he cuts but can't beat the field
so he drags a shortish ball leg side and pick up a single to the ever inviting long-on
brings down the straight bat on off stump and enjoys a single down the ground
fullish and a shade outside off, from around the wicket, JP gets into a drive and the sound off the bat is quite pleasing
finds a good length just outside off, Duminy respects it with a front foot defensive
slower ball ends up a full toss on the pads, Duminy doesn't capitalise as his flick finds midwicket

poor ball, a medium pacer should not be bowling that short. Both batsmen have looked supremely comfortable off the back foot and JP offers another example with an authoritative pull to the midwcket boundary
on the pads again, Duminy shuffles across and retains strike with a flick to square leg
goes on with the arm and JP's guessed the trajectory well, shuffles across and turns his wrists on a length ball to place it through square leg
goes back to a fuller delivery and has to defend just outside off stump
nips down the track and having realised the bowler had outsmarted him by pulling his length back, Faf pushes down the ground
goes back to shorten the length and opens the face to guide a good length ball to point
that was short and Duminy, trying to over-hit it, mistimes a chop to long-on
short and wide, Faf was justified in going for a cut but a little more bounce than he expects takes the outside edge and dribbles down to third man
tossed up on leg, Duminy opts for a sweep but misses
quicker ball on leg stump, punches it down the ground but Utseya races to his left and dives almost through Faf's legs to refuse the single

bowled him around his legs! It was an invitingly full ball outside leg stump, perhaps a little too much so for the sweep, which was the shot Duminy attempted. Can't get under it and it rips across to strike off stump. Big turn, big wicket!
shuffles across in front of his stumps to keep a flatter delivery out
not shy of going for the sweep, this one was not quite as full and he is able to get a little glove down to short fine leg
flighted on leg stump, Miller turns it away to short midiwcket
picked away from outside off, but Faf had made it quite safe by moving outside of it. The ball was flatter as well to help him out
lovely flight and drift for Nyumbu but Miller meets it at its pitch and turns it away through square leg
shortish and outside off, Faf gets up tall to punch down to long-on
bit of turn there and Miller leans forward to defend after adjusting to the turn and a bit more bounce
pushed calmly down the ground
jumps back and punshes a shortish ball through the covers. Excellent footwork to make enough room for himself to free his arms
pushed through to strangle him on leg stump, Miller is a little slow on his flick
again, quicker and darted into the pads and strikes them as Miller's flick doesn't arrive in time
slows it down considerably and gets a little turn. Miller has to follow it and open the face to defend so he isn't beaten and bowled
flatter delivery on midlde and leg, kept out
flighted and drifting on the pads, strongly swept to deep square leg
stays back as he plays the shorter ball turning in at him, pushes into the covers
there is turn on offer, perhaps slow enough for the batsman to adjust, but it does pose a question. This one turns across from off stump, beats Miller's tentative poke to hit his pads
a little fuller this time and Miller is a touch more confident with his front foot stride, tucked away through midwicket
goes back and plays the flatter length, flicked from middle to midwicket
nips down the track, but Williams pulls his length back. Miller tries to adjust with a tap into the leg side but the turn beats him
flighted on middle and off, Miller flicks it along the ground to midwicket
goes back and turns it away to midwicket
brilliant! Lovely flight and drift in on off stump, luring Miller into a defensive push. But he plays inside the line, or is made to look so with the amount of turn on offer
a touch shorter from Nyumbu and Miller, as every batsman before him, is solid off the back foot
a little more room and Miller cuts to deep point
whips a good length ball from outside off stump to deep square leg.
gets back as far as he could and thumps a length ball down the ground. The field is in though
stays back and defends a flatter ball on off stump
tossed up on middle and leg, Faf keeps to his crease and defends
stays back, perhaps unwisely, to a flatter and fuller ball, But he has been there long enough that his hands adjust and he flicks through the square leg region
very little flight there and Miller stays back and chops into the covers
startling turn, ripping from outside off to way down leg. And it stayed low as well. Miller hits it uppishly past the outstretched right hand of short fine leg
flatter and quicker and angled in on middle, flicked away to midwicket
backs away and cuts in between point and short third man
width on offer but Miller's footwork is absent. Mistimes a chop to cover
can't fool me twice says Miller as he uses a straighter blade to drill a shortish ball through the covers.
fuller delivery with a little nip away from the bat, Miller shoulders arms
lovely stroke! Fluent stride forward and a solid thwack off the bat as he drives along the ground to the right of long-off
pulls all the pace off the ball and the offcutter ducks in at Faf. Settles for a defensive push
moves across outside off and walks at the bowler, his footwork is quick enough to ensure the bowler can't adjust properly. Flicked down to long-on
tossed up on middle, pushed back at the bowler
he has hit that so hard he nearly toppled off his feet! This was a rank long hop, turning further away. Faf had to wait a touch and then pummels it into the vacant spaces at cow corner
tossed up on middle and leg, Faf eases it through midwicket and receives some warm applause for an important fifty
on a length, which allows Miller to go back and punch down to long-on
just a hint too short again and Faf has whipped it through midwicket for a couple
hits a good length on middle, Faf prefers the back foot and whips to mid-on
good length ball moving across him, Miller waits on his front foot and flays it through the covers
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed down to long-on
uses his full height and whirls his bat down on the short of a length ball and forces it through the covers
nips in rather late off a fuller length and Faf is lazy on the drive. Pulls his bottom hand off the bat and the inside edge goes to ground
drummed down the ground, but Madziva is good in his followthrough. Although this nailed him more than him doing anything. That's the Miller timing
fuller delivery pushed across him, Miller doesn't play at it
turns it in from outside off, Faf pushes it down to long-on
Miller strikes his first four by going back to this short ball and he punches it with room through the covers for four
makes room again, pushes it down to long-off this time
turning it in from length outside off, Faf helps it to midwicket

chipped straight to midwicket, Utseya removes the set batsman! He pitched it up towards middle stump, not giving it much flight, and Faf flicks it straight into Chigumbura's hands around waist height.
full on leg stump, tucked straight to midwicket to end the over
full and wide, Miller drives it to sweeper cover for one
on length outside off, pushed off the front foot towards point to get off the mark
short of length outside off, Miller cuts it off the back foot after the turn. That one bounced extra after pitching
he releases the pressure with a massive six, it hits the roof! It was tossed up outside off, Miller picked the length and launched it over the long-on boundary for six. Brave shot from the man
flighted outside off, pushed through the covers for one more
beats him, that was mighty close! He gave it some flight to pitch it on length on off, the batsman leaned forward to block but the ball turned a little to nearly get the outside edge
flatter delivery coming in towards leg stump, clipped off the back foot to deep square leg
tossed up around middle and leg, McLaren pushes it back
loud appeal for the arm ball that was flat and hit him on the back foot in front of leg stump, but it was probably going down leg because of the angle and they get a leg bye
too full and wide and Miller doesn't let those go! Goes down on a knee and drives it on the up square of the wicket in the air, there's nobody in the deep
towards the stumps this time, pushed down to mid-on
nearly in the block hole on middle and leg, drives it down to long-on for one
angles it in from short of length, clipped down towards long-on with soft hands for two quick runs
slower delivery on length outside off, it was turned to long-on and they had settled for one but a misfield from Raza at long-on gave them the second. He couldn't pick it up while running in
short and going down leg, goes for a wide past Miller's pull
length delivery coming in towards middle stump, flicked towards deep midwicket in the gap for two quick runs despite an accurate throw at non-striker's end
smacked on the off side! He wants to make full use of the Powerplay - made room for the short ball outside off and smashed it over the cover boundary for six
that's off the pad and gone for four! Miller tried to clip it fine with the angle and it went off his hip down the leg side, beating short fine leg
tries a yorker and it's a low full toss tucked to deep midwicket for one
attempted yorker goes down leg for a wide

loud appeal for lbw and the finger's gone up! He got the yorker right this time on middle and leg, Miller came down a step and got hit on the shoe in front of middle and leg while trying to drive it on the on side but missed. Can't say for sure if it was out because of the angle, but looked very close in real time
slightly slower and coming in from length, thick edge goes towards cover
another appeal, this one's turned down. Came in sharply from length outside off, Parnell wanted to put it away with the angle and got hit in front of leg, that was going down leg
going down leg further, flicked behind square on leg for one to get off the mark
length delivery outside off, he defends it towards cover
targets the middle stump, McLaren pushes it towarsd long-on for one
lets it turn by going to the back foot and tucks it to deep midwicket
short of length and turns a long way towards leg, the batsmen withdrew his shot at the end as the ball went off the pad. No runs then
touch fuller and it's clipped off the back foot to midiwicket
he gets hit on the thigh pad after sharp turn and bounce
attempts a sweep and a top edge falls well short of deep fine leg
fuller on the off stump, turned straight to midwicket
just wide of cover as a leading edge off a drive flew past Chigumbura and went for a single towards wide mid-off
bring it in from outside off, solid defence goes to mid-on
bangs in a short one outside off, tucked off the back foot to deep square leg
even shorter - a bouncer this time as Parnell sways out of the line, one bouncer for the over
swinging in and nearly a yorker, punched down to mid-off for a quick single

the crowd goes berserk, another catch has been taken! He pitched it wide outside off and seeing the room, McLaren went for a big drive on the up and handed a simple catch straight to Chigumbura at cover point
length delivery around middle and off, swept to short fine leg for one with the help of a misfield
too short and a bit outside off, pushed with the turn to cover
on off stump with better length, pushed to cover off the back foot
pitched up on the stumps again, defends off the back foot
stays back to another ball as it turns away from length and he helps it to point
misses in an attempt to cut it off the back foot after the turn

run out chance missed! Parnell drove the full ball down to mid-on and Abbott went for the single despite a no from Parnell, the fielder tried a direct hit but missed as Abbott was nearly halfway down the pitch
short ball around off, pulled off the toes to deep square leg
full on the off stump, thick edge off a drive rolls down to first slip and a misfield gives them a single
attempted yorker is a low full toss on the pads and it's put away in the gap to the wide long-on boundary for four! He saw it coming in full and clipped it away over the in-field for a boundary
length delivery coming in from length, solid defence on the off side
strays down the leg side and Parnell flicks it in the air behind square for one to keep strike
goes down the leg side for a wide
outside off this time and he cuts it late delicately towards the boundary before Taylor cuts it off
flighted a bit outside off, pushed straight to cover
full outside off, defends it back to the bowler
he gets it in the gap, it was short outside off and he let it turn to come in before cutting it past point for three
flatter delivery on middle stump, swatted down to long-on
on length outside off, driven to cover against the turn
comes down to loft it over the in-field and gets hit on the pad
turning in from well outside off, cuts it late towards backward point
tossed up on middle stump, drives it on the up to long-off
in the air, one bounce to deep square leg. He swept it with the turn in the air and it fell well short
the ball stops a bit as he tried to push it down the ground
towards leg stump and it's tucked towards midwicket
on length outside off, punched down the ground towards mid-off for a quick single
back of length just outside off, guides it wide of point for one
too full and wide and it gives Abbott the opportunity to swing his arms and put it in the gap between mid-off and cover or four
brings it in with the angle from length around off, Abbott defends it back
wide outside off again and Abbott gets a thick leading edge to loft it over point, square on the off side in the gap for another four
full and wide, drives it to cover at the edge of the circle for one
on middle stump from round the wicket, pushed towards cover who picks it up and throws unnecessarily at the non-striker's for overthrow
pushed to extra cove this time and this direct hit would have cost SA but they get another overthrow
reverse sweeps it to short third man for one
brings it in with the angle, pushed to cover
fuller on middle stump, pushed down easily towards long-on
comes down the track and clips it to the leg side to deep midwicket for one
full and outside off Parnell smashes it straight down the ground over the bowler's head in the gap to beat long-on for four
quick, full and wide, Parnell fails to get bat on it

lofts it down the ground again, this time it's going to long-off and Williams runs in a long away to take a great catch diving forward! It was full and outside off, Parnell couldn't get the middle of the bat and Williams got there just in time
loud appeal for lbw for the incoming delivery as he tried to whip it away but got an inside edge onto his pad before it went to the off side
short of length outside off, drives it past cover to the deep for one
in the block hole on off and middle, pushes it down to long-on
short of length outside off, drives off the back foot to cover
comes down the track for a big one but it's full and an inside edge goes towards backward square leg
one more, Williams gets his first wicket! He pitched it up and close to Abbott, not giving him much room and Abbott lofted it a little wide of long-on and Raza ran in to take another good catch

another good catch on the run from Zimbabwe in the deep, all over for South Africa! It was a short delivery asking to be put away and Phangiso pulled it in the air to deep midwicket where Nyumbu ran to his left to take it over his left shoulder

inn2.comm: a little too full and outside off and Masakadza eases it through the covers.
better length there as he probes the corridor outside off. Masakadza does not bother with it
brings the batsman forward but doesn't afford him an easy drive. Masakadza is tight enough and pushes to mid-off
a little shape away from the batsman, but Masakadza ensures it's for nothing as he doesn't play

well bowled! Always useful that bouncer, especially when it is as close to off stump. Bent his back to get a little more pace and gets the ball to rise up to the batsman's chest. Masakadza sways away from it nicely
another short ball, perhaps a little too short and early enough for the batsman to gauge it and get out of the way
the experiment starts off in shaky fashion. Mutumbami is hustled by Parnell's pace as he gets back to defend. Inside edge veers away behind him
shortish delivery, but he does well picking it away off his stomach
width offered and accepted by Mutumbami who slashes it to third man
short of a length and Masakadza needs his height to get on top of the bounce to tap down the ground
gets into the pull as he sees the ball pitched short, skids off the deck a little too quickly for him to connect
flicked away off his toes, Masakadza had timed it well but Duminy at square leg throws himself at the ball to prevent any run

dropped by AB! He has had a shocker of a game! A feeble poke from Mutumbami to negotiate a good length ball that seams away. Second slip only has to move a foot or so to his left, but he shells it. Poor work that from the captain
shortish on and around off stump, defended far more confidently
banged in short, Mutumbami sinks under it although he should be careful of that periscope
tries to flick a good length ball off his pads, but he doesn't get any wood on it
fuller and angled in at the batsman who plays all around it, mild appeal for leg before as it crashes low on the front pad, but that would have slid down
bouncer to end the over, but Masakadza jerks his torso away from it
flings down a yorker that homes in on his boot, Mutumbami is slow in getting his bat down again. Things aren't quite peachy with him
short ball, rising up towards his chest, Mutumbami gets up on tippy-toe to blunt it down
too quick for him again! Parnell bangs another one into the middle of the deck and watches as Mutumbami barely gets something a pull down to fine leg
short and wide from Parnell, Masakadza flashes hard to no avail
fullish on middle and leg, Masakadza's feet stay put as he whips it to mid-on
shortish and angled across him, Masakadza taps it into the covers
full and nipping back in at Mutumbami, who pushes back down the pitch. Late movement almost got the better of him
he's sneaked one of those in every over and this time Mutumbami is made to snap his body into C to evade its line

this one's full and Mutumbami displays a confident drill down the ground. That should get him into better state of mind. Miller chases it down, hurtles into a face-first drive and flicks it back just in time

lovely, probing bowling from Abbott. He's making good use of his height and deriving some pace off this deck with those short balls, and nearly all of them are over off stump. Masakadza doesn't want anything to do with it, rightly
stays back and taps a shortish ball into the covers
length ball, massacred! Picked it up from off stump and mauled it to the midwicket boundary
strays on the pads, but Mutumbami meets it with a straight face into the on side

away it sails into the grass banks at fine leg! South Africa's short-ball barrage doesn't work on this occasion as Mutumbami sits on his back foot and hooks with everything he had. Two shots and Zimbabwe are rolling
or not quite. Sets up for the pull again and he looked to tear the hide off the ball again. Not quite short enough, nor did it give enough room for him to free his arms
fuller on off stump, gets forward to block with bat and pad tight together
shortish and pushed across the batsman, Mutumbami is is back behind it and punches into the off side
full and wide, the sucker ball, lures Mutumbami into a lash but he doesn't connect
darts on in on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
comes down the track and taps this good length ball into the covers
stays back to a flighted ball on off stump and opens the face as he pushes into the covers
ventures down the track again but this ball doesn't turn and he is late on the flick. Wears it on the pads
flighted on leg stump, heaved away with a sweep to deep square leg

guess AB knows better than me! This was the arm ball, skid on off the deck to smack Mutumbami below the knee-roll. Poor shot as he was looking to flick across the line. The closed bat face had no chance.
invites the drive, althougth the batsman has no trouble when the ball is that full. Pushed to mid-off

timberrr! Masakadza looked like he had it covered with a push down the ground, but there was gap between bat, which came down at an angle from gully, and pad and the inside edge pings into the stumps. Reward for bowling a good length for Parnell as leg stump cartwheels
fuller delivery nipping away a touch, Taylor shoulders arms
good length ball slid across him, doesn't interest Taylor
hurls it full on off stump, Taylor jams his bat down on it to prevent further progress
forces him forward with a good length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
looks like this is a ploy. Raza races down the pitch and blocks into the leg side
flighted, and his pace is a little quicker too, Raza has to hurry into his forward defensive
tossed up around the off stump, constantly dragging the batsman forward and to play away from the body.
looped up and drifting in on middle and leg, kept out safely
touch too short that time, but Raza doesn't wait long enough for that cut and can't find the gap
stays back again as he sees this on a length and punches to mid-off. Maiden for Phangiso
fuller delivery outside off, he steps forward to push down the ground
pushed down to mid-on, nice straight face meeting the fuller ball on off stump
that was loose and Taylor takes full toll. Wafts a half-volley miles outside off and he lets his hands flow freely through the ball and hammer the ball through extra cover
gets back and across and punches into the covers. Parnell pulled his length back quite a bit there
fuller delivery searching for the outside edge, Taylor is wary of its threat and lets it go
good length ball on and around middle, picked away towards midwicket
flighted on off stump, Raza is kept to a forward defensive
nips down the track, but he is hit on the pads having been unable to reach the pitch. Loops up towards the covers
steps down and blocks a flighted ball in front of middle
and finally the shorter one arrives, but Raza was looking to flay that a little too hard to time it. Gets a bottom edge
lovely flight and drift towards the leg side, Raza makes a little room and drills it down the ground. Silly mid-off, after a fumble, prevents the single
fullish on off stump, brings Taylor forward with a block
pushes him back this time with a short ball on off stump, Taylor's defence is just a solid
stray on the pads and Taylor has an easy single through square leg
Raza leaps off his feet to get on top of a short ball just outside off
full, angled in, seaming further as well. Raza has not read that at all, he is surprised by the movement and has ended up offered the ball free passage onto his off stump
banged in short, but its down the leg side and he is penalised for it
fullish and slid across Williams, who exhibits a far better leave
flighted on middle and leg, Taylor tries to tuck it behind square leg but can't hit the gap
opens the face as he is drawn forward on off stump

hint of turn off a good length, but it helps the batsman who stays deep in his crease and whips it down to the long leg boundary. Faf chased after it, tumbled in a last-ditch effort to save it and seems to have hurt his arm
more turn for Phangiso and had Williams missed his cut, which he was playing from middle and leg, things could have been interesting
pushed down the ground as this was a flatter length on off stump
stays back to negotiate a good length ball with a straight face
good length ball on off stump, Taylor is forward with a dead bat
a touch shorter and Taylor steadies himself on the back foot and punches through the covers, opens the face on impact to hit the gap past a diving point
switches around to the left-hander and seeks the blockhole. Williams plays all around it, but the angle would have taken it down leg after he was hit on the pads
struck on the pads again as Williams looks to flick. Fuller delivery perhaps straying a little too straight allows a leg bye
gets forward to a good length ball and blocks outside off stump
pushed down the ground and he realises mid-on was hugging the circle. Tahir isn't the most threatening of the South Africa fielders and he pinches a run
turn straight away, veering in from outside off  to strike his front pad reasonably low. But he was playing a shot and he was struck outside off
flighted on the stumps, Taylor looks to unsettle him with a reverse sweep
jumps back and across on off stump and turns it away towards midwicket
tossed up on off stump, he lunged forward to defend
whipped away to mid-on as Duminy floats another one on middle and leg
looped up, on middle and off. Kept out
full and a touch too straight, Williams could have exhibited a bit more intent there but finds the fielder at midwicket with a tame flick
good length ball pushing across the left-hander, Williams refuses to play
he seemed to favour a pull there, but decides against it and leaves a short ball outside off
fullish on off stump, Williams opens the face and sneaks a single to point
that's more like it. Taylor wades into a fuller ball on his pads and cracks it over midwicket. Smart wristwork from the former captain.
good length ball on off stump, gets forward and defends
derives some turn off a good length, Williams has to push his hands at it and is lucky the ball doesn't go up
flighted on off stump, he drives down the ground to long-off
flatter around the off stump, cracked away into the off side

he flung his head down in disappointment the minute he met the ball. Raced down the track and perhaps got a little too close to it. Goes for the loft and forces it with a lot of bottom hand... right down long-on's throat
down the leg side and it's helped to deep fine leg delicately for two
tossed up on middle, thick inside edge goes past midwicket for a single
angles it in from length outside off, Elton replies with a solid defence
too wide outside off, helped to deep third man with a late cut
length delivery outside off, he leaves this time
angled down the leg side, clipped to deep fine leg off the pad
angled across Williams from length outside off, he lets it go
angled across again just outside off, he defends it to cover point
short of length outside off, cut to deep third man off the back foot
length delivery outside off, steered to point off the back foot
on length outside off, defends off the back foot towards cover
short ball on middle, Williams is disappointed with himself for not putting it in the gap, he hit it straight to mid-on
on length outside off, left alone by Williams
angled across again, pushed off the back foot to cover
starts this spell with a wide down the leg side
too wide and full outside off, steered with the angle wide of deep third man for two
down the leg side for the left-hander too, another wide
angles it in from outside off, Williams defends it on the off side
slightly wider outside off, cut off the back foot to point
wide outside again, Williams slices it uppishly in the air to third man after a couple of bounces
from wide of the crease and angling it in, Chugumbura tries to steer it to third man but misses
in the block hole outside off, he digs it out to cover
nearly in the block hole outside off, steered to point off the back foot
length delivery on off stump, pushed down to mid-off with a straight bat
back of length outside off, guides it straight to point
outside off on length and angling away, left alone
back of length outside off, swatted past midwicket in the gap as Miller chases and keeps it to two
right on the middle stump, Williams defends it back
another wide from Parnell - way outside off and outside the batsman's reach
coming in from outside off, defends off the back foot towards cover point and Williams is sent back for the single
towards off stump on length, he blocks it back

bangs it in and Chigumbura hands a simple catch to mid-on! It was short and quick and rushed on to the batsman who pulled to put it away but only lobbed a sitter to Duminy. Parnell does a little jig for his second wicket
angles it in from short of length, he defends it on the leg side
slightly slower and back of length from outside off, Jongwe defends it back
fuller and outside off, Jongwe looks to poke but misses
on length outside off, pushed softly to the left of point where du Plessis dives and saves a run or two
shorter delivery around middle and off, Williams defends it back
bangs in a short ball and Williams pulls awkwardly, while trying to take evasive action, to deep midwicket
angled in towards middle and leg, tucked to square leg with a thick inside edge as the face of the bat closed
on the off stump, not giving any room, Williams defends it on the leg side
short of length on leg stump, pulled to deep backward square leg in the gap for four past a diving fielder in the circle
short of length outside off, pushed down to long-on after the turn
on length outside off, cut to point off the back foot
sharp turn this time from outside off, not giving Williams any room to cut this time
lower through the air now, Williams plays the shot early and his sweep is beaten
presses forward and blocks it towards cover
goes back for the shorter delivery and steers it to the leg side for one
full on middle and leg, drives it down to long-on
charges down the track and middles it over wide long-on for a massive six! He came down and middled the length ball
comes down and yorks himself this time, manages an inside edge
shorter delivery around middle, swats it to midwicket
flighted outside off, comes down to push it to long-off
takes a step down to drive it down to long-on for one more
full toss on off stump, turned down to long-on for one
flighted on off stump, drives it down to long-on again
gives the charge and drives it straight to mid-off
steers the short of length delivery to the leg side with the turn
on length on of stump, defends towards cover after it turns away
flipper to end the over just outside off, Jongwe's bat comes down just in time to defend it
sweeps the length ball against the turn to deep midwicket where AB dives to his left and saves two runs
comes down and there's nobody at long-off, the ball falls out of Miller's reach after staying in the air
can't connect the sweep this time for the ball that was outside off on length
gives the charge again, it's slightly short and flat, thick edge goes to long-on
back of length outside off, guides to point off the back foot
flatter outside off, pushed to cover to end the over
googly pitches on off and turns away, Williams pulls it to deep midwicket where it lands after a bounce
comes down and drives the full ball to cover
on the off stump now, pushed straight to cover
googly comes in from outside off, pushed down to long-on for one
leans forward to defend the ball from outside off
leans forward again and pushes the googly to deep cover for one
on middle stump, Williams pushes the full delivery down to mid-on
just outside off on length, helped to point off the back foot
bounces a bit extra after pitching on middle on length, tucked to midwicket for one
Amla takes it at slip! It was a short of length ball well outside off, Jongwe played it late to run it fine but it was too fine and Amla leapt to his right to take a low diving catch
leans forward to push the delivery from outside off to cover
but he bowls a bouncer towards the batsman and he ducks, it's called a wide for the height
on target this time, on the off stump, Utseya defends it back with a tight defence
length ball comes in from outside off, Williams defends off the back foot
shorter one outside off, Williams cuts with force but can't middle it
low full toss well outside off, pushed back to the bowler
swats away the short of length ball from off to deep midwicket
on off and turning away, pushed with the turn to deep point for one
short and wide, slapped down the ground past a diving mid-off for two more
length ball coming in from outside off, pushed off the front foot to point
presses forward and pushes it to cover this time from outside off
back of length outside off, it flies off the bat towards third man
full outside off, pushed down to cover off the front foot
on length around off stump, Williams defends it back to the bowler
full delivery outside off, he drives it straight to cover
on the off stump on length, pushed back to the bowler
quicker one on off stump, defends it to cover
flighted outside leg stump, helps it to the leg side
googly coming in from outside off, drives to cover off the front foot
flighted again a little bit, pushed down again
drifts it in a bit towards off stump, pushed to cover again and that's a maiden
on the off stump, Williams reverse sweeps it straight to point
smacked to the other side with the conventional sweep and it goes all the way! It was around off and he smashed it to the deep midwicket boundary for six
towards the pads, clipped to midwicket for one
slower on leg and turning down, helped to backward square for one more
tossed up on off, pushed down towards long-on but JPD runs to his left to cut it
charges down, Duminy pitches it flat on leg and Williams drives it firmly down to long-on
short and turning in, helped with the turn to square leg
stays towards off stump this time, pushed on the off side this time
short of length and coming in, defends to midwicket off the back foot
well outside off, he reverse sweeps it past short third man for two
tossed up outside off, thick inside edge goes behind square on leg
drifts in towards off and turns away, pushed off the front foot towards point
flat around off stump, defends it back to the bowler
it's short, Williams' eyes light up and he goes back to smack it through the covers after the turn for four to bring up his fifty
short and flat this time, turned to deep midwicket this time
falls just short! It was tossed up outside off, Utseya chipped it down the ground and fell short of long-on
just outside off on length and Williams tucks it down to long-on
around off stump this time, Utseya defends it towards midwicket
fullish and slid across the left-hander, not bothered with
shortish and a shade outside off, Williams tries to flat bat it down the ground, but mistimes it to mid-off
gets back and taps a shortish ball from outside off stump through midwicket
neatly ridden down to point with an open face as he gets on top of the bounce
hits a good length on off stump, Utseya steps forward and blocks ably
shortish and has enough room for Utseya to guide it through to cover
not quite there for the drive, and he realises it. Checks his stroke as he hits a good length ball on the up

he's holed out to mid-off! Slaps his bat down on his pad as he walks off. It was a similar ball, but this time he goes full-on with the drive and offers a simple catch to Parnell. A brave fight, and the only one from Zimbabwe's batsmen comes to an end
gets back in line with a good length ball and keeps it out of his stumps
fullish and angled in on off stump, defended under his eyes
there's that skiddy short ball from Abbott. It's been difficult for the top order to handle those and this time the tailender is late into a fend
short and angled in at the body, Utseya swivels on his back foot and pulls it down to the long leg boundary. Excellent shot, used the pace of the bowler brilliantly
pokes at a back of a length delivery outside off and is beaten soundly
keeps to a shortish length just outside off, this time Madziva manages to shuffle across enough to cover the line
nips back in off a fuller length, but the batsman is rooted to the crease. Looks to guide to third man and is rather slow on the shot too
good length ball on middle, pushes towards midwicket
fuller delivery draws Madziva forward and seams away just enough to beat the outside edge. Abbott's probed away without too much luck today
defends inside the line of another testing delivery that nips away outside off. Abbott throws his head back in mild disappointment
goes for a push down the ground and since mid-on was up in the circle. Hit it straight enough to make the shot relatively risk-free
ventures fuller on off stump, Utseya drills it back at the bowler
gets back and across on off stump and defends stoutly
wafts outside off stump, with his feet stuck to the crease, McLaren gets the ball to jag an inch or so away and beats the bat
forces himself on the front foot and pushes a good length ball into the covers
good length ball just outside off, gets forward to block as the party continues in the crowd. It's amazing how their smiles never fade. Sweet dance moves too
straightens off the deck after opting to go back of a length, Madziva goes hands-first at the ball and misses
fuller ball, but still the same result. Gets the ball to nip away past the outside edge and this time Madziva had attempted to slap it into the on side
back of a length and outside off, punched back at the bowler, but the hands were led far away from the body
jumped down the track, but he's fooled by Parnell digging it in and angling it at his head. He ducks and tries to swat it away into the leg side
whack! This had width and Madziva finally gets a good chunk of it. Hammered away through the covers. But wait, Parnell has overstepped, big time
whack again! only this time its the ball thudding into the batsma's grille. Another short ball, excellently directed. Madziva goes for a pull, but misses
back of a length on leg stump, flicked away but it goes off his thigh pad
tossed up on middle, Madziva closes the face and whips it away to midwicket
skips down the track and pushes into the covers. They opt for a quick single and in comes a direct throw, but the batsman is quite safe
good length ball on middle, he backs away and taps into the off side
that's poor. Offers up a short ball and he rocks back to cut to deep point
nicely flighted on middle and off, a little bit of turn and Madziva covers it late
jumps down on middle and yorks himself. Lucky that didn't sneak through
shortish and outside off, Utseya tries to drag it to the leg side and gets an inside edge
flings down a fuller ball three feet down the leg side
shortish and outside off, Utseya shuffles across to cut and misses
this time he connects off the middle, pulls a short ball from outside off to the midwicket boundary with considerable authority
brings him forward with a fuller ball outside off, Utseya can't beat the cover field
chops a shortish ball outside off to point

up comes the finger, the batsman was dancing down the track and then whipped across the line of a straight delivery. It was a yorker that hit him on off stump and might just have gone on to clatter leg. Utseya was rushing back, thinking he would have been given the benefit and topped the off bail when his bat tickled the stumps as well
length ball on middle, heaved away towards the midwicket boundary
good length ball with a little turn away, defended and gets an outside edge
tossed up on off stump, he leans forward into a defensive push
lures him forward again and defends
gets down on one knee and hammers a slog sweep away much to Bulawayo's delight
tossed up and turning outside off, Nyumbu goes for an encore but only connects with a whole lot of air
starts with a full toss, seems to be his signature ball, pushed down to long-on rather tamely
goes for a sweep right across the line and against the turn. Jumps into an appeal, a plea for leg before but not given

this was pushed through, was the googly too. Nyumbu goes back to whip it into the leg side but doesn't succeed. Huge appeal for lbw, and de Kock held the deflection as well. Tahir went into three appeals, but none of them were upheld. Should have been considering he was in front of middle
gets down and sweeps it, not convincingly but finds three to square leg
flighted on the pads, Madziva gets down the track and lofts it over midwikcet
they've decided to have a bit of fun here. Another leap down the track and a slog over the leg side. Ends up with an inside edge onto his boot
tossed up just outside off, Madziva sweeps it to short fine leg
muted appeal for leg before as Nyumbu uses a sweep again, hit outside the line on his back leg
down the track and slams it down the ground. Falls short of the man in the deep
more glee for the home crowd as they jump up and dance as Nyumbu jumps down the track, gets down on one knee and slugs it over midwicket
shorter and quicker from Phangiso and he opens the face to pick up a single behind point
uses his feet and almost yorks himself in search of a single down the ground
nicely flighted on off stump, Madziva goes for the sweep and gets struck on the pads. Would have missed off with the turn though
saw him advancing and fired it in quicker, it was the flipper too. The batsman tries to jam his bat down on it and it dribbled past the keeper. Tahir is not amused
drilled back at the bowler, almost carried to Tahir too
stays in his crease and whips a flatter ball away to deep square leg
goes for a googly, but it has been picked and Nyumbu cuts to point
good length ball on off stump, Madziva goes right back in his crease to defend
ventures down the track and pushes a good length ball back at the bowler
gets down for a sweep as he sees this one flatter and angled in at him, doesn't connect and the ball wanders away off his pads. Appeal denied because that would miss leg
gets on top of the bounce and sweeps with the bat face closed so that it doesn't go up in the air towards short fine leg
slammed down the ground, that time he advanced and made lots of room for himself to unleash a full swing of the arms
swept away, quite strongly too but this shot is made by its placement. Kept well fine of deep square leg and the bowler's flatter trajectory only helped him
loopy delivery that grips and turns and beats the batsman's intention of slugging him over the leg side. His back foot was inside the crease though so it didn't matter if de Kock didn't collect
full toss on middle and leg, Nyumbu shovels it up in the air but it doesn't reach the man in the deep
got 'im! This was full and straight and he celebrates befitting his reputation. Punches the air and gives the departing batsman a stare. One sweep too many for Madziva
googly straight up, lovely flight again. Vitori did not pick it as he went for the sweep and is beaten
fires in a yorker on off stump, this time the batsman is alert enough
quicker and flatter googly, Vitori read it and cuts towards point. Not much conviction behind the shot, but then again he is a No.11
tossed up outside off, he lunges forward and sweeps to deep midwicket
launched to the long-on boundary! His eyes lit up at the flight on offer and held nothing back, Smote over mid-on's head and eventually dribbled to the boundary
rocks back and hammers a six over midwicket. Up comes a roar from Bulawayo. Poor ball from Duminy as he allowed the batsman enough time to line him up and smack him
two in a row! that's on the roof! Pushed through on leg stump and Vitori plants his front leg away and pummels another sweep shot. JP has a wry smile as he checks the hang time on that
bowls it even faster this time and Vitori just about gets an inside edge to it
this is a lot slower, but Vitori is waiting on the back foot and the shortish delivery is cut away quite smartly behind point. That makes it 21 runs off the over!

he was walking back to collect his sweater by the time the umpire finally agreed with him. Tahir was that certain this was out. Short ball turns big outside off, Nyumbu goes for a cut and feathers a bottom edge to the keeper
